description: An Italian diminutive of Amore, the god of love.

entries.meaning: (in art) A cupid or putto (representation of a naked baby or small child, often with wings).
examples: One of his best peeces he wrought in Pisa, which was all sorts of worldly and sensuall Epicures, rioting and banquetting vnder the shaddow of an Orenge tree, within the branches and bowes whereof, sly little Amorettos or Cupids, shooting at sundry Ladies lasciuiously dancing and dallying amongst them  […]
Amoretti — a set of sonnets by Edmund Spenser describing his courtship and marriage (1595).
What is Life, and the best things in life, with which her Amorettoes and Idolatrous Adorers are so delighted?
